items.title: Build your first GraphRAG Powered Agent! (No Graph Expert Required) | Databases for AI

ai.summary: Based on the available descriptionâ€¦ The session explains that knowledge locked in docs, PDFs, and wikis can make AI less effective and that knowledge graphs can unlock that information. It demonstratesâ€”via a live demo with real documents and a provided sample notebookâ€”how to build a GraphRAG-powered agent in an afternoon using the same AI tools teams already use.
bullets: Problem: important knowledge is trapped in docs, PDFs, and wikis.
Solution: knowledge graphs (GraphRAG) can unlock that information for AI reasoning.
Approach: build one in an afternoon using familiar AI toolsâ€”no six-month project required.

takeaways: Unlocking knowledge in operational documents can improve the utility of AI systems used by grid/data center teams.
A knowledge-graph approach (GraphRAG) can be implemented quicklyâ€”potentially reducing timeline compared to long projects.
Using existing AI tools minimizes the need for new tooling or extensive retraining.

items.title: Cloud Cost Efficiency I The Keys to AWS Optimization | S16 E2

ai.summary: Based on the available description, this livestream explores the key metrics that drive AWS cost efficiency, focusing on KPIs like cost per transaction, resource utilization rates, and ROI calculations. It also covers practical approaches to benchmarking, identifying optimization opportunities, and building dashboards to align technical performance with business outcomes for cloud engineers, FinOps teams, and technical leaders.
bullets: Key KPIs: cost per transaction, resource utilization rates, and ROI calculations.
Practical methods for measuring, tracking, and optimizing AWS spending.
Benchmarking techniques to spot cost-efficiency opportunities.
Guidance on building dashboards to communicate value to stakeholders.
Audience: cloud engineers, FinOps teams, and technical leaders.
takeaways: Measure cost-per-transaction and ROI to quantify cloud spending impact and compare options.
Monitor resource utilization rates to identify overprovisioning and right-size resources.
Use benchmarking to prioritize high-impact optimization opportunities.
Build clear dashboards so stakeholders can see financial and technical trade-offs.

items.title: Follow the carbon, find the money: Turning sustainability into financial value

ai.summary: Based on the available descriptionâ€¦ Rich Goode, Sustainability Principal at PwC US, argues that sustainability resonates when framed in business terms by linking carbon reduction to financial impact. Translating emissions outcomes into cost savings and business value helps move sustainability from ambition to action, and leaders should understand carbon accounting to drive alignment, investment, and results.
bullets: Link carbon reduction to financial impact to engage leadership.
A ton of carbon is abstract; financial value is concrete and persuasive.
Translate emissions outcomes into cost savings and business value.
Understand the fundamentals of carbon accounting.
Communicate sustainability in business terms to drive alignment and investment.
takeaways: Frame emissions reductions as measurable cost savings to justify grid/data center upgrades and efficiency projects.
Quantify carbon outcomes in financial terms to secure leadership buy-in and budget allocation.
Develop carbon accounting capabilities to track progress and demonstrate ROI.
Use business-language metrics (financial impact, cost avoidance, ROI) to align stakeholders and unlock investment.

items.title: Bringing In $251K A Year With 3 Jobs In The Bay Area

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Naseema McElroy, a 44-year-old labor and delivery nurse in Brentwood, California, went from nearly $1 million in debt in 2015 to being debt-free by 2017 after learning better money management. She started a personal finance brand, Financially Intentional, to document her debt-payoff journey and now earns $251K a year by working three jobs in the Bay Area.
bullets: Naseema McElroy is a 44-year-old labor and delivery nurse in Brentwood, CA.
In 2015 she had nearly $1 million in debt and then learned to manage her money.
She founded Financially Intentional to document her debt payoff journey.
By 2017 she was debt-free.
She currently brings in $251K annually by holding three jobs in the Bay Area.
takeaways: Multiple income sources can materially increase total compensationâ€”expect higher pay demands or side-income activity in high-cost regions like the Bay Area.
Personal branding and documenting a financial journey can be turned into a business stream, suggesting opportunities to leverage employee expertise for external-facing content or education.
Rapid, disciplined debt reduction demonstrates the impact of focused financial strategiesâ€”apply similarly measurable, disciplined approaches to cost-control and budgeting decisions.

items.title: GeForce Garage - Summer of RTX Community Build
